title: Kind of a stupid question here about Windspeakers.
body: Does Windspeakers blessing increase the heal from Summoners Heal? If so wouldn't it make more sense for support to take heal and ADC's to be in control of the exhaust?

replies.body:
F for Flash.
D for D'other spell.
Exhaust is a much better roaming Summoner spell.

{{summoner:3}} is the best over all choice for a support 

unless... you are playing a kill lane and going ham then {{summoner:14}} will help if you are able to get the lvl 2 advantage in lane and go crazy providing more of a kill threat... but {{summoner:3}} dont fall like {{summoner:14}} does as the game goes

it does increase {{summoner:7}} and got played in an pro-tournament once actually.

but it died down fast simply because it's hard to rely for your support to heal you in an coordinated teamfight and also exhausting primary targets is better done by the support.

On lane it is good, but in teamfights these tactic will backfire on you.

Funny story, for a couple of months in Korea (dont remember exactly could be any time beween s2 and s4) the adc got exhaust and support heal. Because often adcs would split a bit late game and it was a more usefull summoner. Ofc it used to be strong duelers like Vayne in meta.

it does but the cd on the summoner is the issue... but it does increase the shield on {{item:3190}} let alone the shields from other champs like {{champion:40}} {{champion:25}} {{champion:43}} and you used runic armor makes it strong as well by increasing healing shields and regen on YOU by 8% and then you include items like {{item:3504}} {{item:3222}} {{item:3401}}
Can't wait to be able to test these kind of things in the new sandbox mode. Pre-Season hype
I don't believe it does, but even if it does the cooldown on heal is much too large for windspeaker's to be a convincing argument for switching.
I want to say yes, but I have this thought in the back of my head that says Riot made an exception to Summoner Heal when increasing Heal power.
